meanings.definition: The activity or profession of buying and selling stocks or securities on behalf of clients.
meanings.sent1: Her stockbrokings involved managing investments for her clients.
meanings.sent2: He made a successful career out of stockbrokings.
meanings.sent3: The cat's stockbrokings in the toy market were quite profitable.
meanings.sent4: His stockbrokings were like a well-oiled machine, always making the right moves.
meanings.sent5: The stockbrokings of the young entrepreneur were the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in the business of buying and selling stocks or securities.
meanings.sent1: Their stockbrokings led to significant financial gains.
meanings.sent2: The stockbrokings of the company were closely monitored by investors.
meanings.sent3: The stockbrokings competition was fierce but friendly.
meanings.sent4: Her stockbrokings were like a dance, each move carefully calculated.
meanings.sent5: The stockbrokings of the seasoned trader were legendary in the industry.

meanings.definition: The practice of trading stocks or securities on the stock market.
meanings.sent1: Learning about stockbrokings was part of his finance course.
meanings.sent2: The stockbrokings on Wall Street never seemed to slow down.
meanings.sent3: His stockbrokings strategy was to buy low and sell high.
meanings.sent4: The world of stockbrokings was like a fast-paced game of chess.
meanings.sent5: She dove into stockbrokings with enthusiasm and determination.
